books.title: Design as Art
books.author: Bruno Munari
books.notes: Munari's notes on the role of design in everyday life. A classic that challenges you to see design everywhere.

books.title: Thinking with Type
books.author: Ellen Lupton
books.notes: My most recommended book on typography for beginners. Essential reading for anyone working with text.

books.title: The Design of Everyday Things
books.author: Don Norman
books.notes: A foundational text on human-centered design. Everyone recommends it for a reason.

books.title: Interaction of Color
books.author: Josef Albers
books.notes: Color is contextual. This book changed how I think about color relationships.

books.title: A Pattern Language
books.author: Christopher Alexander
books.notes: Perfect for reading random chapters at a time! A peek at various patterns in urban planning & architecture.

books.title: Understanding Comics
books.author: Scott McCloud
books.notes: I recommend this to all designers interested in improving their visual storytelling skills.

books.title: Grid Systems in Graphic Design
books.author: Josef MÃ¼ller-Brockmann
books.notes: The go-to book about traditional grids. Essential for understanding systematic design.

books.title: How Buildings Learn
books.author: Stewart Brand
books.notes: What happens after buildings are built? A fascinating look at how structures adapt over time.

books.title: Speculative Everything
books.author: Anthony Dunne & Fiona Raby
books.notes: Conceptual design used to explore potential futures. Mind-expanding.

books.title: Visual Explanations
books.author: Edward Tufte
books.notes: Tufte's thoughts on presenting information visually. Trust that the user can process all the information!

books.title: Design is Storytelling
books.author: Ellen Lupton
books.notes: My #1 rec for anyone trying to understand how to think like a designer.

books.title: The Poetics of Space
books.author: Gaston Bachelard
books.notes: A philosophical exploration of intimate spaces. Dreamlike and profound.

books.title: CAPS LOCK
books.author: Ruben Pater
books.notes: How graphic design and capitalism are intertwined. Critical and eye-opening.

books.title: Mismatch
books.author: Kat Holmes
books.notes: How inclusion shapes design. Essential reading on accessibility.

books.title: Race After Technology
books.author: Ruha Benjamin
books.notes: How does technology continue to reinforce racism? Critical tech studies.

books.title: Dear Data
books.author: Giorgia Lupi & Stefanie Posavec
books.notes: A year of hand-drawn data visualizations exchanged as postcards. Beautiful and inspiring.
